data.title: Completely removed all conversion steps for Dune 2000

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Fixes 
- #2293
- #2345
- #2566
- #3279
- major part of #3298

While this greatly improves the Dune 2000 mod first start experience there are some regressions because not all Dune 2000 sprite features are yet implemented namely
- #2211
- #3113

and I removed many manually photo-shopped sprites and Red Alert dependencies. However with those issues visible everyone can now easily contribute fixes just by editing yaml files which make the d2k mod much more maintainable.

data.title: Dedicated server crashfix
data.body: This fixes starting units by removing the bogus check. This makes it no worse than changing race, which also isn't validated, for the same reason.

data.title: Improve RA lobby dropdown group background.
Feature Request: Portable Installation

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
_FEATURE REQUEST:_
Option to install portably.

_IMPLEMENTATION:_
Installation:
- Option during Installation or
- zip download (complete)
- zip download + download game data files + dependencies on first run.

File Structure:
- Game data files & OpenAL.dll (etc)  & the config file all sit somewhere in root game directory. Not all the third-party dependencies need be there, but the uncommon ones should.

_REASONING:_
Portability is quite useful. This is free software, yet for new users it is quite difficult to copy without re-installing and re-downloading content. 
I once spent hours at a lan (with no internet access) trying to figure out how to get the thing running on everyone's pcs. With everyone's combined limited knowledge, we eventually got it figured out.

_EDIT:_
In an ideal implementation of this request the game would look for these files locally before looking in the default directories. Special packaging like that provided by _linuxportablesoftware_ or _PortableApps_ should not be required.

data.title: Improved turret and muzzle offsets for buggy and jeep in CnC mod
Move orders can give away hidden structures
data.body:
Issuing a move order to a location reveal the presence of an invisible frozen building.

The move target line should indicate the original ordered position, and the actor move as close as they can.

The fix for this probably wants to be tied in to a more general fix for move orders into unpathable terrain, which currently causes the unit to do nothing.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/776457-move-orders-can-give-away-hidden-structures?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove BelowUnits trait
data.body:
Relative ZOffsets can now be set via sequences, so this is redundant as well as being incorrect (it removes any relative ZOffsets set via sequences or traits).
#3665 makes a start by removing it from bibbed structures, but it is still used in a few other places (e.g. husks).

data.title: Get the hash of map files using OpenRA.Utility
data.body: if there is anything really wrong with this im sure someone will let me know.

data.title: Polish fixes for muzzle flashes and cash ticks.
Muzzle anims drawn below unit body and turret when they shouldn't

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
This is most noticable with the cruiser.

When for example the cruiser is facing down/south, and the turrets facing and shooting south-west (the cruisers on the temperate shellmap are a good example), the muzzle flashes of the turret on the back of the ship are not only drawn below the turret, but even below the ships' body.

In my opinion the muzzle should only be drawn below the turret shp if the turret is facing "away" from the viewer (i.e. north, north-west, north-east and so on), and should generally never be drawn below the body if the unit has a turret, as a turret is normally meant to sit above the body.

data.title: Rework bibs (again).

This replaces BibLayer with per-actor bib rendering in preparation for per-player FrozenUnderFog.
The last two commits are other uncontroversial prerequisites, so I have included them too.

data.title: C&C mod snow brightness fix
data.body:
Reduces brightness of snow a little, gives more contrast to darker patches.

There recently was a complaint somewhere (forgot where it was) that the snow of the cnc mod is too bright. This was likely a result of the conversion, since C&C and RA use different palettes.

I figured the easiest way to fix this was editing snow.pal. The C&C snow terrain mostly uses color 239 for regular snow and color 192 for darker patches, so I reduced the brightness of color 239 by two steps, and decreased the brightness of color 192 by 4 steps (except for the blue value, which got decreased by only 1 step).

data.title: Cleanup kill/death counts
data.body: fixes #3417 on the way.

data.title: Minor sound fixes
data.body:

data.title: Revert kill/death count when husks are involved
data.body:
fixes #3417

I chose this solution because Health is located in OpenRA.Game.dll in the OpenRA.Traits namespace and Husk is in OpenRA.Mods.RA and I could not easily solve this otherwise.

data.title: Draw RA production tooltips next to the mouse pointer
data.body: This is a follow-up of #3652 because I was annoyed that the bigger tooltips overlap with the performance text and why are tooltips rendered here at a fixed position and not next to the mouse pointer as in C&C. Still needs all that redundant code it touches to be merged so this crap can be removed.

data.title: Performance Graph Cleanup
data.body: Fixes #3491 and removes redundant code. Again the C&C chrome logic mostly won.

data.title: RA mod Explosion & ImpactSound revamp
data.body:
Revamps the explosive side of the RA mod.

Changes some explosion animations and adds impact sounds (for water as well), for more variety and a more lively battlefield.
Much better than my first attempt from a few months ago, I think.

data.title: Attempt to fix some rare exceptions in HackyAI
data.body: Fixes #3642.

data.title: Completed support for password protected games
data.body:
![passworded-server](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/933659/cf45bff0-005a-11e3-93f7-b60d422c912d.png)

I found existing widgets and a dummy password in the handshake request. This makes it configurable. If mod authors dislike this they can just remove the password widget and all servers will be created with blank passwords making this feature therefore completely optional. My personal believe is that passwords are useful if you want private games especially during prime time where kick-banning random people is annoying and mean.

![password-failed](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/756669/933666/07f27b36-005b-11e3-82a6-9eacff0bfca8.png)

Has been requested in #2290, #3284 and #3367 as well as opposed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2693#issuecomment-14678472.
